text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
rainbow unicorn cake pop tutorial I'm
going to be showing you how to make this
gorgeous little unicorn cake pop with a
rainbow mane I've had so so many
requests for something unicorn from you
guys and this is your channel so I want
to make things that you guys love
watching today I'm really excited to
show you how to make this absolutely
gorgeous unicorn cake pop so tools and
equipment that we will be using today
I've got some lollipop sticks a pair of
scissors I've got a knife I've got a pre
rolled cakepop ball now if you don't
have a great recipe for getting your
cake pop to this stage ready to dip and
decorate I will leave a link to the my

there to show you how I shape to the
head today and I've also got another

decorated with just to save a bit of
time I've got some black candy melts
melted I've got a little bit of melted
white chocolate or melted white candy
melts I've got some white sprinkles or
white nonpareils some plain water I've
got one miniature pink marshmallow and
I'm just going to use that to fashion
the ears today one piece of candy corn
that we're going to use for the horn if
you don't have access to candy corn
where you are you can also fashion a
little bit of fondant just into a long
triangle shape to make a horn but you
will need to do that the day before just
to let that horn completely dry before
you try to attach it to your cake pop
I've got some Rainbow sour straps now
these are candy straps or sour straps we
get them here in Australia and I know
that you can pick them up in America
other parts of the world if you don't
have access to these rainbow sour straps
you can roll some fondant in a bit of a
rainbow pattern and it doesn't have to

the rainbow look but really make them
your own I've got some toothpicks and a
little bit of wax paper or grease proof
paper so let's get started now as I
mentioned I'm going to show you how to
roll this head shape it is really simple
you've got your lovely ball and you're
just going to take your two hands and
just rock down in the palm of your hand
and you're just making almost like a bit
of a strawberry shape something like
that you don't want the nose to be too
pointed or too rounded but you just want
it to be sort of like a little bit of a
muzzle there so that's what you're
looking for
your cake pop shape now as I mentioned
this one here has been refrigerated so
once I've shaped it i've refrigerated it
for about 15 minutes so it's really nice

get into our cake pop to much is we want

there we're going to dip that in our

just taking that white chocolate you
just want to dip it in one side and tilt
it over so the white chocolate comes all
the way up both sides there but doesn't

shake off to get off any excess and then
I like to put it pink side down onto
that piece of greaseproof paper and
that's going to allow it to completely
dry don't worry if you've got any little

just knock those off once it's all dried
so just again with the second one and
down ready to dry now I've pre-made some
of those just for a little bit of speed
for us today for your unicorn horn
you're going to take that piece of candy
corn and it's a little bit too big as

just take a sharp knife and just cut

to add a little bit of shimmer and this

just give it a little shake and just a

when you do this on fondant or on other

is just a different surface it really
just gives it a nice shimmer now let

for little tassels in it you want to cut

and you can't really tell that they're a

a bit more time and not right before you

you want to let that seal completely set

this front section of his face is going

don't push it in too far because you

you want to take those two ears one and

now taking your little fringe
slided it should sit nicely on that on

you can take your toothpick here and
just use that just to push the little

because you kind of want those sides to

male
or you can also use dark chocolate I've

don't try to wipe it off while it's wet
because you're going to make a bit of a

tip it in the water so there you've got
